verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489> responded, <WH6030> <WH559>
"Should a wise <WH2450> man <WH2450> answer <WH6030> with windy <WH7307> knowledge, <WH1847> And fill <WH4390> himself <WH990> with the east <WH6921> wind <WH6921>?
"Should he argue <WH3198> with useless <WH3808> <WH5532> talk, <WH1697> Or with words <WH4405> which are not profitable <WH3276>?
"Indeed, <WH637> you do <WH6565> away <WH6565> with reverence, <WH3374> And hinder <WH1639> meditation <WH7881> before <WH6440> God. <WH410>
"For your guilt <WH5771> teaches <WH502> your mouth, <WH6310> And you choose <WH977> the language <WH3956> of the crafty. <WH6175>
"Your own mouth <WH6310> condemns <WH7561> you, and not I; And your own lips <WH8193> testify <WH6030> against you.
"Were you the first <WH7223> man <WH120> to be born, <WH3205> Or were you brought <WH9123> forth <WH9123> before <WH6440> the hills <WH1389>?
"Do you hear <WH8085> the secret <WH5475> counsel <WH5475> of God, <WH433> And limit <WH1639> wisdom <WH2451> to yourself?
"What <WH4100> do you know <WH3045> that we do not know <WH3045>? [What] do you understand <WH995> that we do not?
"Both <WH1571> the gray-haired and the aged <WH3453> are among us, Older <WH3524> <WH3117> than <WH4480> your father.
"Are the consolations <WH8575> of God <WH410> too <WH4480> small <WH4592> for you, Even the word <WH1697> [spoken] gently <WH328> with you?
"Why <WH4100> does your heart <WH3820> carry <WH3947> you away? And why <WH4100> do your eyes <WH5869> flash, <WH7335>
That you should turn <WH7725> your spirit <WH7307> against <WH413> God, <WH410> And allow [such] words <WH4405> to go <WH3318> out of your mouth <WH6310>?
"What <WH4100> is man, <WH582> that he should be pure, <WH2135> Or he who is born <WH3205> of a woman, <WH802> that he should be righteous <WH6663>?
"Behold, <WH2005> He puts <WH539> no <WH3808> trust <WH539> in His holy <WH6918> ones, <WH6918> And the heavens <WH8064> are not pure <WH2141> in His sight; <WH5869>
How <WH637> much <WH637> <WH3588> less <WH637> one who is detestable <WH8581> and corrupt, <WH444> Man, <WH376> who drinks <WH8354> iniquity <WH9390> like water! <WH4325>
"I will tell <WH2331> you, listen <WH8085> to me; And what <WH2088> I have seen <WH2372> I will also declare; <WH5608>
What <WH834> wise <WH2450> men <WH2450> have told, <WH5046> And have not concealed <WH3582> from their fathers,
To whom <WH1992> alone <WH905> the land <WH776> was given, <WH5414> And no <WH3808> alien <WH2114> passed <WH5674> among <WH8432> them.
"The wicked <WH7563> man <WH7563> writhes <WH9123> in pain <WH9123> all <WH3605> [his] days, <WH3117> And numbered <WH4557> are the years <WH8141> stored <WH6845> up for the ruthless. <WH6184>
"Sounds <WH6963> of terror <WH6343> are in his ears, <WH241> While at peace <WH7965> the destroyer <WH7703> comes <WH935> upon him.
"He does not believe <WH539> that he will return <WH7725> from darkness, <WH2822> And he is destined <WH6822> for the sword. <WH2719>
"He wanders <WH5074> about for food, <WH3899> saying, 'Where <WH346> is it?' He knows <WH3045> that a day <WH3117> of darkness <WH2822> is at hand. <WH3027>
"Distress <WH9496> and anguish <WH4691> terrify <WH1204> him, They overpower <WH8630> him like a king <WH4428> ready <WH6264> for the attack, <WH3593>
Because <WH3588> he has stretched <WH5186> out his hand <WH3027> against <WH413> God, <WH410> And conducts <WH1396> himself arrogantly <WH1396> against <WH413> the Almighty. <WH7706>
"He rushes <WH7323> headlong <WH6677> at Him With his massive <WH5672> <WH1354> shield. <WH4043>
"For he has covered <WH3680> his face <WH6440> with his fat, <WH2459> And made <WH6213> his thighs <WH3689> heavy <WH6371> with flesh. <WH6371>
"And he has lived <WH7931> in desolate <WH3582> cities, <WH5892> In houses <WH1004> no <WH3808> one would inhabit, <WH3427> Which <WH834> are destined <WH6257> to become ruins. <WH1530>
"He will not become <WH6238> rich, <WH6238> nor <WH3808> will his wealth <WH2428> endure; <WH6965> And his grain <WH4512> will not bend <WH5186> down <WH5186> to the ground. <WH776>
"He will not escape <WH5493> from darkness; <WH2822> The flame <WH7957> will wither <WH3001> his shoots, <WH3127> And by the breath <WH7307> of His mouth <WH6310> he will go <WH5493> away. <WH5493>
"Let him not trust <WH539> in emptiness, <WH7723> deceiving <WH8582> himself; For emptiness <WH7723> will be his reward. <WH8545>
"It will be accomplished <WH4390> before <WH3808> his time, <WH3117> And his palm <WH3712> branch <WH3712> will not be green. <WH9569>
"He will drop <WH2554> off <WH2554> his unripe <WH1155> grape <WH1155> like the vine, <WH1612> And will cast <WH7993> off <WH7993> his flower <WH5328> like the olive <WH2132> tree. <WH2132>
"For the company <WH5712> of the godless <WH2611> is barren, <WH1565> And fire <WH784> consumes <WH398> the tents <WH168> of the corrupt. <WH7810>
"They conceive <WH2029> mischief <WH5999> and bring <WH3205> forth <WH3205> iniquity, <WH205> And their mind <WH990> prepares <WH3559> deception. <WH4820>"
